summary.span: Represents a 64-bit signed integer.

span.span: Represents a 64-bit signed integer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是表示不可变的值类型的有符号整数值，其范围从-9223372036854775808 (这由常量) 到 （这由+9223372036854775807之间常量。 is an immutable value type that represents signed integers with values that range from negative 9,223,372,036,854,775,808 (which is represented by the constant) through positive 9,223,372,036,854,775,807 (which is represented by the constant. .NET Framework 还包括 64 位无符号的整数值类型， ，它表示从 0 到 18446744073709551615 之间的值。The .NET Framework also includes an unsigned 64-bit integer value type, , which represents values that range from 0 to 18,446,744,073,709,551,615. ## 实例化的 Int64 值Instantiating an Int64 Value 可以实例化有几个方面的值：You can instantiate an value in several ways: - 你可以声明变量并将其分配的范围内的整数值数据类型。You can declare an variable and assign it a literal integer value that is within the range of the data type. 下面的示例声明了两个变量并将它们分配在这种方式中的值。The following example declares two variables and assigns them values in this way. [!code-csharp[System.Int64.Instantiation#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.instantiation/cs/instantiate1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Int64.Instantiation#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.instantiation/vb/instantiate1.vb#1)] - 你可以分配其范围是子集的整数类型的值的类型。You can assign the value of an integral type whose range is a subset of the type. 这是一个不需要强制转换运算符在 C# 或 Visual Basic 中的转换方法的扩大转换。This is a widening conversion that does not require a cast operator in C# or a conversion method in Visual Basic. [!code-csharp[System.Int64.Instantiation#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.instantiation/cs/instantiate1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Int64.Instantiation#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.instantiation/vb/instantiate1.vb#4)] - 你可以分配其范围超过数值类型的值的类型。You can assign the value of a numeric type whose range exceeds that of the type. 这是收缩转换，因此如果需要强制转换运算符在 C# 和 Visual Basic 中的转换方法`Option Strict`上。This is a narrowing conversion, so it requires a cast operator in C# and a conversion method in Visual Basic if `Option Strict` is on. 如果该数值为， ，或包括小数组件，其小数部分处理的值取决于编译器执行转换。If the numeric value is a , , or value that includes a fractional component, the handling of its fractional part depends on the compiler performing the conversion. 下面的示例执行收缩转换将分配到的几个数值变量。The following example performs narrowing conversions to assign several numeric values to variables. [!code-csharp[System.Int64.Instantiation#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.instantiation/cs/instantiate1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Int64.Instantiation#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.instantiation/vb/instantiate1.vb#2)] - 你可以调用的方法类能够将任何支持的类型到值。You can call a method of the class to convert any supported type to an value. 这是可能因为支持接口。This is possible because supports the interface. 下面的示例阐释了数组的转换值复制到值。The following example illustrates the conversion of an array of values to values. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToInt64#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.toint64/cs/toint64_1.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToInt64#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.toint64/vb/toint64_1.vb#4)] - 你可以调用或方法将转换的字符串表示形式值赋给。You can call the or method to convert the string representation of an value to an . 字符串可以包含十进制或十六进制数字。The string can contain either decimal or hexadecimal digits. 下面的示例演示使用十进制和十六进制字符串分析操作。The following example illustrates the parse operation by using both a decimal and a hexadecimal string. [!code-csharp[System.Int64.Instantiation#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.instantiation/cs/instantiate1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Int64.Instantiation#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.instantiation/vb/instantiate1.vb#3)] ## 对 Int64 值执行操作Performing Operations on Int64 Values 类型支持标准的数学运算，例如加法、 减法、 除法、 乘法、 求反和一元求反。The type supports standard mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, negation, and unary negation. 与其他整数类型，类似类型还支持的按位`AND`， `OR`， `XOR`，左移位和右移位运算符。Like the other integral types, the type also supports the bitwise `AND`, `OR`, `XOR`, left shift, and right shift operators. 你可以使用标准数值运算符比较两个值，也可以调用或方法。You can use the standard numeric operators to compare two values, or you can call the or method. 你还可以调用的成员类来执行各种数值操作，包括获取绝对值的数值的数字，计算商和整数除法运算的余数确定两个最大或最小值长整型，获取数字的符号和舍入数。You can also call the members of the class to perform a wide range of numeric operations, including getting the absolute value of a number, calculating the quotient and remainder from integral division, determining the maximum or minimum value of two long integers, getting the sign of a number, and rounding a number. ## 字符串形式表示 Int64Representing an Int64 as a String 类型提供对标准和自定义数字格式字符串的完全支持。The type provides full support for standard and custom numeric format strings. (有关详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)，[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)，和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。)(For more information, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md), [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md), and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md).) 若要设置格式值为一个不带前导零的整数字符串，您可以调用的无参数方法。To format an value as an integral string with no leading zeros, you can call the parameterless method. 通过使用"D"格式说明符，您还可以包含指定的数目的字符串表示形式中的前导零。By using the "D" format specifier, you can also include a specified number of leading zeros in the string representation. 通过使用"N"格式说明符，可以包含组分隔符和指定的十进制位数才会出现在字符串的数字表示形式。By using the "N" format specifier, you can include group separators and specify the number of decimal digits to appear in the string representation of the number. 通过使用"X"格式说明符，您可以表示十六进制字符串形式的值。By using the "X" format specifier, you can represent an value as a hexadecimal string. 下面的示例在一个数组中的元素进行格式设置以下四种方式中的值。The following example formats the elements in an array of values in these four ways. [!code-csharp[System.Int64.Formatting#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.formatting/cs/formatting1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Int64.Formatting#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.formatting/vb/formatting1.vb#1)] 你还可以设置格式通过调用十进制或十六进制字符串值作为二进制、 八进制方法并提供将基作为该方法的第二个参数。You can also format an value as a binary, octal, decimal, or hexadecimal string by calling the method and supplying the base as the method's second parameter. 下面的示例调用此方法以显示二进制、 八进制和十六进制形式表示的整数值的数组。The following example calls this method to display the binary, octal, and hexadecimal representations of an array of integer values. [!code-csharp[System.Int64.Formatting#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.formatting/cs/formatting1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Int64.Formatting#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.formatting/vb/formatting1.vb#2)] ## 使用非十进制 32 位整数值Working with Non-Decimal 32-Bit Integer Values 除了使用作为十进制值单个长整型，你可能想要执行按位运算替换为长整型值，或使用二进制或十六进制表示形式之间实现的长整型值。In addition to working with individual long integers as decimal values, you may want to perform bitwise operations with long integer values, or work with the binary or hexadecimal representations of long integer values. 值以 63 位，64 位用作符号位为单位表示。 values are represented in 63 bits, with the sixty-fourth bit used as a sign bit. 正值表示通过使用符号数值表示法。Positive values are represented by using sign-and-magnitude representation. 负值都以 2 的补数表示。Negative values are in two's complement representation. 这是重要上执行按位运算时，需要注意值或当你处理的单个位进行运算。This is important to keep in mind when you perform bitwise operations on values or when you work with individual bits. 若要执行数字、 布尔值或对任何两个非十进制值的比较操作，这两个值都必须使用相同的表示形式。In order to perform a numeric, Boolean, or comparison operation on any two non-decimal values, both values must use the same representation.

span.span: As with any other type, reading and writing to a shared variable that contains an instance of this type must be protected by a lock to guarantee thread safety.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法实现接口，并且执行效果略好于方法因为它不具有要转换`value`对对象的参数。This method implements the interface and performs slightly better than the method because it does not have to convert the `value` parameter to an object. 具体取决于您的编程语言，它可能会对代码其中的参数类型具有较少的位的方法 （为较窄） 比实例类型。Depending on your programming language, it might be possible to code a method where the parameter type has fewer bits (is narrower) than the instance type. 这可能是因为某些编程语言中执行的隐式的扩大转换，它表示具有任意数量的位的实例作为类型参数。This is possible because some programming languages perform an implicit widening conversion that represents the parameter as a type with as many bits as the instance. 例如，假设实例类型是和参数类型是。For example, suppose the instance type is and the parameter type is . Microsoft C# 编译器生成的指令来表示形式的参数值对象，然后生成比较的值的方法实例和参数表示形式。The Microsoft C# compiler generates instructions to represent the value of the parameter as an object, then generates a method that compares the values of the instance and the parameter representation. 请查阅你的编程语言的文档，以确定其编译器是否对数值类型执行隐式的扩大转换。Consult your programming language's documentation to determine whether its compiler performs implicit widening conversions on numeric types. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示泛型和非泛型版本的多个值和引用类型的方法。The following code example demonstrates generic and nongeneric versions of the method for several value and reference types. span.para: 编译器重载决策可能应对明显的差异的两个行为方法重载。如果之间的隐式转换自变量和定义和自变量并不类型化为，编译器执行隐式转换和调用方法。否则，它们调用方法，始终返回如果其参数不是值。下面的示例阐释了两个方法重载之间的行为差异。情况下， ， ， ， ，和值，第一个比较返回因为编译器自动执行一个的扩大转换，调用方法，而第二个比较返回由于编译器调用方法。 [！ code-csharp[System.Int64.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#1)][！ code-vb[System.Int64.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#1)]

Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. If an implicit conversion between the argument and an is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers perform an implicit conversion and call the method. Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not an value. The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. In the case of the , , , , , and values, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method. [!code-csharp[System.Int64.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.equals/cs/equalsoverl.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Int64.Equals#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.int64.equals/vb/equalsoverl.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式值在默认的 （"G"或常规） 中使用的格式当前区域性的对象。The method formats an value in the default ("G", or general) format by using the object of the current culture. 如果你想要指定其他文件格式或区域性，使用的其他重载方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定区域性A specific culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下面的示例显示值使用默认方法。The following example displays an value using the default method. 它还显示的字符串表示形式通过使用数量的标准格式说明符得到的值。It also displays the string representations of the value that results from using a number of standard format specifiers. 示例使用 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定来显示。The examples are displayed using the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式值在默认的 （"G"或常规） 中使用的格式指定区域性的对象。The method formats an value in the default ("G", or general) format by using the object of a specified culture. 如果你想要指定不同的格式或当前区域性，使用的其他重载方法，如下所示：If you want to specify a different format or the current culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|区域性For culture|使用的重载Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |默认值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|默认值 （当前） 区域性Default (current) culture|| |特定的格式A specific format|特定区域性A specific culture|| `provider`参数是一个对象，实现接口。The `provider` parameter is an object that implements the interface. 其方法返回提供此方法返回的字符串的格式的区域性特定信息的对象。Its method returns a object that provides culture-specific information about the format of the string that is returned by this method. 实现的对象可以是任何以下：The object that implements can be any of the following: - A代表要使用其格式设置规则的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting rules are to be used. - A对象，其中包含特定的数字格式设置信息，此值。A object that contains specific numeric formatting information for this value. - 实现一个自定义对象并且其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。A custom object that implements and whose method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`或对象不能从获取`provider`，返回的值进行格式设置为当前区域性的对象。If `provider` is `null` or a object cannot be obtained from `provider`, the return value is formatted with the object for the current culture. .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下面的示例显示的字符串表示形式值使用表示几种不同区域性的对象。The following example displays the string representation of an value using objects that represent several different cultures. 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 此实例返回的值进行格式设置为当前区域性。The return value of this instance is formatted with the for the current culture. ## Examples 下面的示例显示值使用每个支持标准数字格式说明符以及两个自定义数字格式字符串。The following example displays an value using each of the supported standard numeric format specifiers together with two custom numeric format strings. 在将数字的值转换为字符串，该示例使用 EN-US 区域性的格式设置约定。In converting the numeric values to strings, the example uses the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. A代表要使用其格式设置规则的区域性的对象。A object that represents the culture whose formatting rules are to be used. - A对象，其中包含特定的数字格式设置信息，此值。A object that contains specific numeric formatting information for this value. - 实现一个自定义对象并且其方法返回提供格式设置信息的对象。A custom object that implements and whose method returns a object that provides formatting information. 如果`provider`是`null`或对象不能从获取`provider`，此实例返回的值进行格式设置为当前区域性。If `provider` is `null` or a object cannot be obtained from `provider`, the return value for this instance is formatted with the for the current culture. .NET Framework 提供了广泛的格式设置支持，以下的格式设置主题中的更详细地介绍：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 有关数字格式说明符的详细信息，请参阅[标准数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自定义数字格式字符串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 有关格式设置的详细信息，请参阅[格式化类型](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). ## Examples 下面的示例显示正值和负值的每个支持标准数字格式说明符用于三种不同的区域性。The following example displays a positive and a negative value using each of the supported standard numeric format specifiers for three different cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法就像是方法，除了方法不会引发异常，如果转换失败。The method is like the method, except the method does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 不必使用异常处理来测试是否的事件中`s`无效，无法成功分析。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `s`参数包含一个数字的窗体：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [ws][登录] 位数 [ws][ws][sign]digits[ws] 方括号 ([ and ]) 中的元素是可选的。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表对每个元素进行了描述。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|可选的空白区域。An optional white space.| |*sign**sign*|一个可选符号后。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|范围从 0 到 9 的数字的序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `s`参数被解释使用样式。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the style. 十进制数字，除了允许仅前导空格和尾随空格以及前导符号。In addition to the decimal digits, only leading and trailing spaces together with a leading sign are allowed. 若要显式定义的样式元素以及可出现在区域性特定格式设置信息`s`，使用方法。To explicitly define the style elements together with the culture-specific formatting information that can be present in `s`, use the method. `s`使用中的格式设置信息分析参数初始化针对当前系统区域性的对象。The `s` parameter is parsed using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current system culture. 有关详细信息，请参阅。For more information, see . 此重载方法将解释中的所有位`s`为十进制数字的参数。This overload of the method interprets all digits in the `s` parameter as decimal digits. 若要分析的字符串表示形式的十六进制数，请调用重载。To parse the string representation of a hexadecimal number, call the overload. ## Examples 下面的示例调用与大量的不同字符串值的方法。The following example calls the method with a number of different string values. [!code-csharp[System.Int64.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Int64.TryParse/cs/TryParse1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Int64.TryParse#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Int64.TryParse/vb/TryParse1.vb#1)] 一些字符串，方法不能进行转换在此示例是：Some of the strings that the method is unable to convert in this example are: - "9432.0"."9432.0". 转换失败，因为字符串不能包含小数分隔符;它必须包含仅为整型数字。The conversion fails because the string cannot contain a decimal separator; it must contain integral digits only. - "16,667"."16,667". 转换失败，因为字符串不能包含组分隔符，则为它必须包含仅为整型数字。The conversion fails because the string cannot contain group separators; it must contain integral digits only. - "(100)"."(100)". 转换失败，因为字符串不能包含而不是定义由当前区域性的负号和属性。The conversion fails because the string cannot contain a negative sign other than the one defined by the current culture's and properties. - "01FA"。"01FA". 转换失败，因为字符串不能包含十六进制数字;它必须包含仅为十进制数字。The conversion fails because the string cannot contain hexadecimal digits; it must contain decimal digits only.

*fractional_digits**fractional_digits*

`s`参数可以表示指数记数法的数字，如果`style`包括标志。The `s` parameter can represent a number in exponential notation if `style` includes the flag.| |*hexdigits**hexdigits*|一系列从 0 到 f 或从 0 到 F.的十六进制数字A sequence of hexadecimal digits from 0 through f, or 0 through F.| 仅为十进制数字的字符串 (它对应于标志) 总是可以分析成功。A string with decimal digits only (which corresponds to the flag) always parses successfully. 其余的大多数成员控件可能但不是要求必须包含在此输入字符串中的元素。Most of the remaining members control elements that may be but are not required to be present in this input string. 下表指示个别成员影响中可能存在的元素`s`。The following table indicates
